person.persName: Zebulon Ward (Woodford co State Rep & former penitentiary lessee)

body.p: Woodford County, planter and politician. Cynthiana, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary E. Worthen Ward. Father of William Ward, Adda Ward, Minnie Ward, and Zebulon Ward, Jr. Steamboat clerk on the Mississippi River. Gold prospector in California from 1849 to 1851. Sheriff of Kenton County, Kentucky, in 1853. Lessee of the Kentucky State Penitentiary from 1855 to 1859. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Owned twenty-seven enslaved people in Woodford County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Woodford County from 1861 to 1863.
